subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unit test java documentation
msgSnippet: Give me an example of a listing of your tests.  I d be curious what the names of your tests are. -Dale ... __________________________________ Do you Yahoo!?
messageBody:
Give me an example of a listing of your tests. I'd be
curious what the names of your tests are.

-Dale
--- icepickorama <icepickorama@...> wrote:
> Each one of my test methods is in turn comprised of
> multiple tests
> (for example you may have a method called
> testVectorAdd, but this is
> composed of multiple positive and negative tests).
> Therefore the
> tests names aren't sufficient and only give a fairly
> high-level
> overview of what's being tested.
>
> Personally I find it useful to maintain a list of
> what my unit tests
> are and keep attempt to keep that list synchronized
> with my code, that
> way it's easy to review what tests exist and what
> gaps there are
> without having to go to the code all the time.
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Bob Koss <koss@o...>
> wrote:
> >
> > I'm curious what kind of comments you add (or
> documentation you
> produce).
> > The names of my test methods describe what they do
> and I never felt
> the need
> > for any more documenting.
> >
>
>
>
